triplets: Sports equipment designed to assist players in catching and fielding baseballs
Catching, fielding, and controlling baseballs during games and practice sessions
High-quality leather for durability and flexibility, with stitching thread and sometimes padding materials
Palm, the main gripping area for catching the ball
Fingers that provide structure and help in gripping and controlling the ball
Webbing between thumb and fingers to secure the ball and provide flexibility
Typically brown, but also available in black, tan, or custom colors depending on manufacturer
Baseball games, training, and sports equipment collections
Various sports equipment manufacturers producing gloves for different positions and levels of play
Approximately 0.3–0.5 kg depending on size and materials
Approximately 25–30 cm depending on player size and position
Typically 3–10 years depending on quality, frequency of use, and maintenance such as cleaning and conditioning the leather
